intro: Linociera longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered linociera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, elongated flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Linociera longiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
